snippet: A federal ruling citing “flimsy” evidence and a “deceitful” prosecutor sets the stage for the release of William Lopez within 60 days, unless the prosecution decides to retry him.
abstract: Judge Nicholas G Garaufis of Federal District Court in Brooklyn throws out murder conviction of William Lopez, who has spent 23 years in prison for shooting death of local drug dealer Elvirn Surria; describes in detail case that went awry because of bad witness testimony and weak evidence.
lead_paragraph: A federal ruling citing “flimsy” evidence and a “deceitful” prosecutor sets the stage for the release of William Lopez within 60 days, unless the prosecution decides to retry him.

headline.seo: Conviction Tossed Out in ’89 Killing of Drug Dealer in Brooklyn
headline.main: Conviction Tossed Out in ’89 Killing in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Conviction Tossed Out In ’89 Killing In Brooklyn
